description: Buy the Black Diamond Nut Tool online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Nut Tool
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Nut Tool online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, strong, cheap, works great, what else do you need? A no B.S. nut tool for those who dont care about all the frilly gimmicks. Youll be grabbing this old classic in a pinch every time your latest and greatest torque wrench/clip on/ palm cushioned/laser etched/bottle opening designer multi tool fails you and breaks mid route and leaves you with your nuts in a bind! When youre old, crippled with arthritis and sitting back telling the young punks youre embellished stories of yesteryear. Youll look over to your worn out, thrashed antique rack and this will be the nut tool which survives and still remains attached to your harness.
review.name: Basic is best

review.reviewBody: Does what it is supposed to do, but I dont like that they made the handling end a bottle opener versus putting a gate on it so you dont have to bring another carabiner with you.
review.name: Good First Option

review.reviewBody: Does the job, it's light weight and fits into those cracks good.
review.name: It's a nut tool

review.reviewBody: An absolutely essential piece of gear for those pesky peices of pro that your climbing partner jammed too far, especially after taking a fall or two.  Only reason I gave a 7 is because I regret not buying the self clipping nut tool.
review.name: As Advertised

review.reviewBody: I have only used it a few times but it's been a huge help, would be silly to be placing Nuts without it. The wire gate one is probably the way to go just cause of ease of use but other than that no complaints.
review.name: light and effective

review.reviewBody: I would like to better understand the design of this tool. The original leper nut tool was the best !
review.name: Just a nut tool

review.reviewBody: Solid nut tool; I've never had an issue getting a piece out and thought another tool could do it better. A little annoying that you need a carabiner to attach it to your harness, and having a leash would be nice. The bottle opener end is a nice touch though.
review.name: It works

review.reviewBody: Definitely assist you in recovery of your protection.
review.name: Good pick for stoppers!

review.reviewBody: I have had this nut tool since 2000.  It has worked great for 17 years and does the job it is designed to.
review.name: Great piece of gear.

name: Nut Tool

review.reviewBody: It hangs my stove and is super light. What more can I say. I don't think MSR want me to say this but it also works on my buddy's jet boil.
review.name: It hangs my stove and

review.reviewBody: I don't leave my house without this on any trip that I bring my Reactor on. I often hang it up on the carabiner of my hammock so I can relax and have my food cook at the same time. Once I was stuck in a bad rainstorm and that was handy so I didn't have to put it on the ground or in the rain. A cool small touch is that the stainless cables on mine have turned a nice blue and brown from the heat of the stove in some places, just looks cool.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: Nice casual look. Has a standard fit so not too tight. I got the small and I wear small shirt and jacket size 36. I like that its cozy and very comfy, I also like that it can keep me a little warm without the bulk of a sweatshirt.

review.itemreviewed: Jasper Midweight Flannel Long-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great quality of material and craftsmanship. The coloring was not what I expected but other than that, this shirt is well worth it and shipping and customer service is excellent

review.itemreviewed: Jasper Midweight Flannel Long-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: So comfortable and soft , washes great and colors stay

review.itemreviewed: Jasper Midweight Flannel Long-Sleeve Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought 4 different Marmot flannel shirts (i.e. the one pictured) after Xmas. The heavier weight XL fit true to historical American XL. But not all the mid-weight do. The one made in Vietnam is OK after washing, but the two made in Indonesia were much tighter every before washing and were returned. Not even close to a real XL as other reviews also note. I'm 6'1", 195 athletic build. Length OK but way to tight in chest and body. Unfortunately the XXL is way to big for me.Bad Quality Control / attention to detail Marmot!! Everything else about the shirts are good.
review.name: Caution: Made in Indonesia run much smaller!!!

review.itemreviewed: Jasper Midweight Flannel Long-Sleeve Shirt - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Antora 3 Thermo Mid WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love these boots for walks in the winter. I live in Canada so good boots are a must! They keep my feet warm and they soles are good at gripping ice. The boots run true to size. I'm usually an 8.5 and I got a size 9 so that I could wear thick socks with them.
review.name: Cute, Warm and Useful!

review.itemreviewed: Antora 3 Thermo Mid WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I walk dogs as a side job. I needed boots that keep my feet warm, have great traction, but still feel like a shoe. These are all of that! I walk miles in these boots and they are just as comfortable as my running shoes. I live in Michigan and my feet have stayed warm and dry through the slush and the snow. My yak tracks fit perfectly on them for really icy days too. I cant recommend them enough!
review.name: Great boots!

review.itemreviewed: Antora 3 Thermo Mid WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I recently purchased these boots, and while they are well-made and stylish, they are not very comfortable for those of us without a high foot arch. The arch support is quite pronounced, and I found it uncomfortable for extended wear. If you have flat or low arches, you may want to consider a different style or plan to replace the insoles.
Im not sure if the insoles are replaceable, but that could be a potential solution for better comfort. These boots might be a better fit for someone with naturally high arches.
review.name: Stylish but Uncomfortable for Low Arches

review.itemreviewed: Antora 3 Thermo Mid WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought a pair last winter and the zippers have never stayed up. Once the zipper is down my feet get cold.  Very annoying.
review.name: Very disappointing

review.itemreviewed: Antora 3 Thermo Mid WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Very comfortable boot. I love the side zipper for closure. I was looking for an everyday wet weather shoe. This fits the bill perfectly. 
My only negative comment is the tread is a bit slippery on wet concrete.
review.name: Love this boot

review.itemreviewed: Antora 3 Thermo Mid WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I ended up returning this boot as I did not love it enough to keep. First of all the sizing was correct, but it does not feel warm on my foot which is what I wanted. Also the product description says waterprooof layer but the product has a tag stating water repellent so Im not sure if it is truly waterproof. 100g insulation is not warm enough to call this a winter boot in my opinion. I will be looking for 200 gram insulation.
review.name: just ok
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Antora 3 Thermo Mid WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These with me on a trip to Antarctica and wore them around the ship and all through the airports. Did not use them as hiking shoes because the ship requires you to use their boots which are very durable and probably these would not have held up as well and might have gotten wet.
review.name: Comfortable and warm.

review.itemreviewed: Antora 3 Thermo Mid WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: My favorite shoe so far. am trying to get another pair for my baby
review.name: You will never Regret
comment: Thank you for the amazing feedback!

review.itemreviewed: Antora 3 Thermo Mid WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: This boot was too small for me, I ordered a size 7 as there were no Size 8 left. Loved the colour. Have bought Antora 3 Gortex size 7 good fit.
review.name: Merrell great shoes
comment: Apologies that these did not work out for you. If you need assistance, please give us a call at 800-288-3124.

review.itemreviewed: Antora 3 Thermo Mid WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: The most comfortable and durable all weather shoe.
review.name: Perfect all weather shoe

name: Antora 3 Thermo Mid WP Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I'm going to do an in-depth review of this hoodie just because I have another and I've been a long time fan of their sweatshirts. 

Overall, I gave this a 4/5 just because I did notice some deviances from my favorite hoodie from them. Not all bad! I just do overall like the fit slightly less, but I am very excited to break in my new hoodie!

For reference I am a woman, 5'5", ~115 lbs. Athletic but slim build. I prefer men's hoodies often because they are more roomy and longer length. 

Pros: 
1. Bigger finger holes! My last hoodie from 686 (Men's hoodie of the same style) had much smaller finger holes and I don't use them very often because they are so tight! which must have been a pain for men who bought them as I have small wrists and hands. 

2. A slightly better quality material, depending on preference. My last hoodie from them had a higher cotton content, as this one is a blend. I like 100% cotton but this one does dry faster as I air dry my clothes to prevent extra wear and tear/promote longevity. It's definitely softer than my older hoodie, still warm but it does breathe a little more as well. 

3. The graphic printing is better. My old hoodie had a much thinner and had less staying power than the graphic on my new hoodie. I saw some people complain that it was not embroidered and while I do agree that would have been a nice touch, the screen printing job is a good quality one on the hoodie I received. It feels like almost silicone/rubber rather than just a paint coat that will crack after a few months. It does help I air dry, but like I said, feels like a durable print to me. 

4. Big Hood! I love the big hood size. I wear a lot of hats/beanies with my hood up to keep me warm so I appreciate its not tight; you can always tighten it down more with the hoodie strings. 

5. Small details! Details I liked: caps on the hoodie strings, grommet vents on the pits, bigger finger holes that dont hurt my thumbs, hoodie strings a different color (nice little touch to the style of the hoodie), cell phone pocket (I dont use it for cell phone, mine is huge, I use it for my cards and keys, ChapStick, etc.)

6. Long fit! I enjoy how this hoodie is slouchy but somehow so stylish on me and I think Its the longer, tapered fit. Layers fit Every time I wear it I get tons of compliments, at work, the mountain, my work, etc. I think I enjoy how it has a leaner fit and tapers down some. This creates a lot less bulk and hulk as a woman trying to get something roomy. 

Cons: 

1. I miss the side panel that I feel gave a little more room in the bottom band of the hoodie waist area. My old hoodie has a little panel between the two side seams, and I felt like that both added a little more style and gave just a little more room at the bottom of the hoodie. The only reason why this annoys me a bit is that when I reach up its a little tighter on my hips. Granted this is a mens hoodie and I am a woman, but I am pretty slim. When I laid out the hoodies side by side and measured + laid on top and compared I did notice a tighter bottom waist. Maybe it will stretch a little with time but I just wish it fit more the same. If I got a large the top part would be far too large. Womens hoodies are just far too boxy and frumpy on me. 

2. It would be nice to have more decal options that weren't just straight logos pretty much. My old hoodie has a cool, warped text aspect on a tye-dye fabric and it's much more unique and interesting. 

Overall, I would recommend this hoodie.
review.name: Good, but miss older fit/details just a bit!

review.reviewBody:
Other than the rain cover, its a great bag. I used it for the first time doing the presidential traverse in the White Mountains and it performed great. Its easy to load and unload. It has great compression. It was very comfortable with 30-35lbs in it for a day of hiking. 

The only negative is the rain cover that came with it did not stay on in high winds. It doesnt have anything built in that holds it to the bag and it relies totally on the elastic draw string. There were 60 mph winds one day and it just blew off. Thankfully I had clipped it in with a carabiner, but otherwise it would have been gone down the gulf and I would have had a very wet bag. My wife has an Osprey Aura AG 65 that has a rain cover with two slots for fitting the hip belt through and her rain cover stayed in place perfectly the whole time. I know I could just buy a better rain cover, but this seems like a miss from Osprey on such an expensive bag.
review.name: Great but the rain cover is useless in wind

review.reviewBody: My torso is 17" so I purchased the S/M size expecting it to be on the shortest setting. I found I needed to have it just under the longest setting to fit me correctly with the middle of the hip belt on my iliac crest. I think you might be able to squeeze into this pack if your torso is 19" maximum. Easily the most comfortable pack I have tried on, very happy with my purchase.
review.name: Size and Fit

review.reviewBody: This pack has every feature one would want in a pack except for a MAJOR design flaw. It has 2 friction points on the back adjustment system which rub on my back and leave me with two red chaffing marks and bruises after every long hike with heavier loads (40-45lbs). I originally bought this for mountaineering and it was perfect because I was wearing so many layers due to cold weather. Now that I'm using it in warm weather without the extra layers on my upper body, I have found that the 2 adjustment strap connection points rub on my back and have removed the skin and caused painful bruising. I have adjusted the pack a number of times to see if it would help but have found that nothing works. I own numerous packs for every possible situation and although I love the features of this pack it is simply too painful to use in warmer weather when I am not wearing extra layers to provide some protection for my back. I hate to say it because I love the features but coming from someone that wears a pack at least 3 out of 7 days every week, I would NOT recommend this pack. There are many other brands with different designs that do not have this issue.
review.name: Great features but TERRIBLE for long days with Heavier loads

name: Aether 55L Backpack
Aether 55L Backpack

review.reviewBody: Bought as a gift. My wife loves how warm and cozy this pullover is. The inside is super soft and comfortable as well. The fit was true to size. She highly recommends this to anyone looking for a perfect winter 3/4 zip.
review.name: Best Gift

review.reviewBody: This fleece pullover is close to perfect. As someone else mentioned, the collar is on the big side - one star subtracted for that reason. The fit, overall, is one I like (not tight fitting but also not a parachute fit!). I bought a size small (I am 56, 34 chest, around 125lbs) and it is perfect size for me.
review.name: Close to perfect

review.reviewBody: Perfect for those cold weather.  Warm and yet not bulky!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: This sweatshirt is just the right weight and super comfortable. Just what I was looking for. True to size. It washes well and stayed soft.
review.name: Just What I Was Looking For

review.reviewBody: I love this fleece! It does fit loose/boxy so size down if youre between sizes and want a closer fit. Id say its a versatile mid weight fleece that feels lighter- comfortable over a tshirt in the mid-40s and expect would still be warm with long sleeves in cooler tents. Looks nice with jeans or athletic wear. I expect to wear it often this winter.
review.name: Flattering versatile fleece

review.reviewBody:
Love it, super comfortable and cozy.  Wore it for some late season kayaking so far and it was warm without making me overheat.

Wish it was slightly more fitted and I would love to see more color blocked versions.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody:
Really want to keep this but collar is way too big
Too uncomfortable to leave zipped but when its partially unzipped  looks too big
Material is great and fit was perfect
Unfortunately had to return
review.name: Love the material but collar is too big!

review.reviewBody: I LOVE this pullover! I have been living in it since summer began. It's perfect for cool mornings and evenings. I catch myself always reaching for it because it's cozy and soft, but I'm not going to overheat and sweat when I'm walking on the trail. I love it so much I want to buy another one. I'm so happy to see a clothing product where I can be cozy, but breathable at the same time. Magic!
review.name: Cozy and breathable!

review.reviewBody: I haven't actually gotten a chance to wear this out yet, but I love the color. I'm a big fan of color blocking so I'm happy that this moth color (kind of a pretty mauve/blush hybrid) has some color contrast. It's been too hot here in Michigan to wear it, but hoping I can use it for some cooler summer nights and definitely will be using in the fall for hiking! I'm 5'4" and I weigh around 170 with an athletic, curvy build. The Large is a little loose in the body, but I need it for my shoulders. I like that it's not too tight! Feels cozy and effortless.
review.name: Can't wait to wear for colder seasons!

review.reviewBody: This is a very comfortable and nice-looking layer. It is easy to get off and on--the zipper precludes any struggle in this area. The sleeves are wide enough to easily glide over under layers. For me, it adds just the right level of warmth! It works well outdoors, but I find it to have a good "snuggle factor" for evenings at home.
review.name: Great addition

name: Trail Mix 1/4-Zip Pullover - Women's

description: Buy the Nite Ize GlowStreak Wild LED Ball online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: GlowStreak Wild LED Ball
hasVariant.description: Buy the Nite Ize GlowStreak Wild LED Ball online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Our pup is a heavy chewer and most glow in the dark or lighted balls have only lasted days or weeks with her.  We've had the Nite Ize Disc-O ball for a year now, and it's held up beautifully.  It's definitely water resistant as we have used it in the rain many times.  I've never tried throwing it into a body of water.  I don't think I will after reading other reviews.  But that's okay, I still think it's the best option on the market for a nighttime game of fetch.  We combine it with the lighted collar so we can see both our pup and the ball in the dark.
review.name: Our favorite lighted ball

review.reviewBody: Purchased the glow streak +glow streak wild LEF ball at a local pet store. Cannot get the battery to open (following directions). Dud
review.name: NOPE

review.reviewBody: I think this new ball is great, the LED is bright and the erratic bounce provides my dog with lots of entertainment while we play.  I have used GlowStreak LED balls for years and one of the things that I love about them is that they fit in a chuck-it so I didn't have to pick up a slobbery ball on a cold wet night. I bought the Wild ball assuming it would be the same size and fit in our chuck-it for play, but it is larger than the standard 2.5 in diameter ball.  We'll still play with this ball at night, and my dog will be happy, my gloves will just need more frequent washing.
review.name: Great for nighttime play, doesn't fit chuck-it

review.reviewBody: Convinced you could drop this ball from the space station and it would survive re-entry
review.name: Pack of rabid lions couldn't destroy it

review.reviewBody: Awesome and fun ball!
review.name: Super fun!

review.reviewBody: Bought this a month ago to play with my dog at night since it gets dark here so soon in winter. Battery only lasted a few hours. I then attempted to change the batteries and then the ball didnt light up at all. Expensive toy that only lasted a short time. Wish it was rechargeable like the clip on light. Too bad since my dog loved it while it worked.
review.name: Didnt last
comment: Hi there, we are sorry to hear about the GlowStreak ball didn't last for you, luckily we do have a worry-free guarantee on all of our products and would be happy to help you get a replacement. We can also help troubleshoot some ways to make this ball last longer. Please reach out to us at info@niteize.com and we will get you taken care of.

review.reviewBody:
I recently purchased the Flashlight Dog Discuit as well as the Glowstreak Disc-O Wild LED ball excited to have a nighttime toy to play with my Aussies. Unfortunately, the second time I threw the Discuit the cap fell off and light/battery pack flew out and went MIA. This would have been a great product if the light unit was a screw on/ screw off. 
Secondly, the Disc-O Wild ball worked for a few hours and died. I replaced the batteries and the ball still will not light up. After paying $44 for both toys very disappointing for such high cost. I tried reaching out to customer service and left a couple voicemails but have not received a return call.
review.name: Dog Ball Gone Wrong
comment: Hi we are sorry for the delayed response to your voicemail. We are currently working with one person in Customer Service. If you could send us an email at info@niteize.com. We would be happy to help you out with this issue with our Worry-Free Guarantee. I will find your voicemail and give you a call back today as well.

review.reviewBody: Great
review.name: Dimdblu18

review.reviewBody:
A wonderful toy for nighttime play. Its really funny to see this ball floating in the dark as my French Bulldog runs around the yard with it.

He can handle it in his mouth, barely. Please consider making a smaller size for the smaller breeds. It would be the perfect toy for us if this was an option.
review.name: So fun!

review.reviewBody: Kinda disappointed that it wasn't sized properly to be able to be used with chuckit and other ball throwers. And it only bounces erratically on hard surfaces like concrete and asphalt. Build quality is good and I like the screw in battery holder. Guess I should have just bought the normal ball instead.
review.name: Disappointing...
comment: Hi Nick, I am sorry to hear about your issue with the GlowStreak Wild, and would be happy to help you resolve this. If you could reach out to us at info@niteize.com we would be happy to send out the original GlowStreak ball as a replacement.

name: GlowStreak Wild LED Ball

review.reviewBody:
my 3rd pr of hiking pants from Fjallraven, and as usual, don't disapoint. the keb agile are lightweight, and good for 
long distance backpacking trips.  They wash up nicely in the sink and dry overnight.  Lots of pockets. the pants 
stretch nicely and don't bind at the waist at all. (this is the new updated fit, and i love it)!
review.name: Lightweight, Backpacking pants

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love the keb trousers but I couldnt get over a few flaws. The thicker material is not ideal for summer conditions and the reinforced butt gave me a uni-butt. I recently bought the keb agile trousers and they are perfect. The pants are thinner, still durable, and have quite a bit of stretch! Overall I think these new trousers are the perfect edition to my hiking wardrobe.
review.name: New trousers scratch of all the boxes!!

name: Keb Agile Trousers - Women's

There was plenty of space for all of my toiletries, and I liked all the zipper compartments...including one to prevent leakage from getting all over. I also like the style of the kit even had a built in mirror...I highly recommend for traveling!

review.itemreviewed: Base Camp Voyager Dopp Kit Organizer

review.reviewBody:
I was skeptical due to my history with low end Lake shoes...fir for a pair of 42s was perfect - roomy without being sloppy or loose. they have great build quality and are really convenient to take off and on..
stiff on the bike and power transfer is good without sacrificing comfort...highly recommend..
review.name: skeptical at first

review.reviewBody: Lake shoes are the go to for wide and extra wide feet. Even other brands that describe having wide sizes are too narrow for my feet. However, I have noticed over the years that lake shoes quality has diminished, the material seems to last much less than models from 10 or 15 years ago.
review.name: The only shoe brand for wide feet.

review.reviewBody: Ive heard some recommendations for Lake shoes but havent found them in any stores to see the quality or try them on. After years of accepting imperfections in other shoes I ordered these and I am pleased. Their build quality is noticeably good. Their size chart is accurate. A couple things I was unhappy about are the right cleats inner limit is less than the lefts - meaning the holes arent symmetrical or something and the right shoe is clearly closer to the crank arm than the left. (I have the cleats slammed for widest stance.) Kinda annoying. May get some pedal extensions One of the BOAs was loose and wobbly but tightened down easily with a T6. The insoles are simply a waste of resources. Budget in some better ones with support. Despite these issues, the shoes are 2 Legit 2 Quit.
review.name: Nice

review.reviewBody: I have been searching for wider shoe for longer rides to accommodate my foot as it swells riding off road for 4-6 hrs.  I remember the first time I crushed my plantar nerves in my forefoot during a 24hr solo race in Utah the late 90s thinking a scorpion had stung me, only to find the wear signs of my foot expanding in the shoe. Luckily back then I had been given a Carnac shoe which I slapped on and finished the event with less foot pain.  The  Lakes are not as high volume (vertically) as those, and tighten up better so I don?t fell like I pedaling in Dutch clogs. The heel is a little loose, but  improved with supportive insole.  Fitting  my left foot is challenge in any foot wear I choose as it resembles a duck foot rather muscular greek Atlas foot.  Maybe I should have taken up swimming?   Cheers, from the 3 legged wolf.
review.name: A wide MTB shoe in leather

review.reviewBody: 43 Wide Black/Camo. First impressions are that they are very high quality, fit is excellent.  They weigh 400g per shoe without the cleat.  My old Shimano XC7 were about 325 without the cleat and the S-Works Recon lace were about 300g per shoe.  I returned the Recon because the outside of the shoe dug into my ankle.  I think most of the weight comes from the extra rubber/grip on the bottom of the shoe but the leather is thicker and more substantial all over compared to the XC7 and the S-Works Recon lace ups that I returned.  I'm sure some people use these a "race" shoe but I think they fit best as an all around riding shoe that could be used for races, trail and gravel.  I wish I could say that they don't have any heel slip but they do have some, very tolerable though.  They are very rigid with the full carbon sole so I guess that's to be expected but the amount of heel slip they have is easy to tolerate.  My Giro Chamber II have zero heel slip but they are as flexible as a regular tennis shoe.  The BOA can be adjusted in both directions so that's nice.
review.name: Better than the rest

review.reviewBody:
I needed new shoes, my 25 year old Carnac's are needing too many repairs.
The Lake MX238 was said to be wide so I gave them a try.
Around the ball of my foot and toe box fit well.  My heel also stayed in place.  I can feel air flowing in and around my feet - which is great.
The issue I had/have is around my inside ankles.  The shoe is too high and cut into my ankles.  I had a cobbler cut the shoe down and that resolved the issue at the bottom of my inside ankles.  However, there is still an issue because the plastic piece that holds the boa cable is still a bit high and digs into my foot a bit.  Some more cutting may be needed but this is hampered by the boa piece.  There doesn't seem to be a reason the shoe is so high at that point.  These shoes could be 110% a great product with just a bit of adjustment in design.
review.name: Fit good in most places but not all

review.reviewBody: My Lakes and Shimano XTRs arrived Thursday and new Lynskey gravel bike arrived Friday. Three days later I've tallied 200+ miles. I love these shoes. Light, comfortable, breathable, and beautiful. I wear a 10.5 to 11 wide. My Lakes are 44. Double boa is terrific for small adjustments on a long ride. Just the right amount of room in the toe box. No slippage. Right amount of stiffness. Enter and exit the XTRs perfectly. I switched over from an old pair of Specializeds that I use on my road bike. I won't be wearing those again.
review.name: Great show for wide foot

review.reviewBody: I three different bike shoes before I found the right fit. Customer service made the return process fast and efficient. Hassle free.
review.name: Great Customer Service

review.reviewBody:
I purchsed these Lakes based on reveiws noting that Lake ( and Bont) make cycling shoes that have a wide forefoot, good fitting heels and are not just "oversized shoes" that have excessive volume overall.  
I wear Altra's for athletic shoes because of the need for a wide toe box to accommodate foot issues (bunion, morton's neuroma, metatarsalgia).  My hope was that the lakes would work well for cycling.
The forfoot area in these Lakes was indeed wide & comfortable for my foot issues. 
Unfortunately the heel was not snug at all & the shoes slipped. This even occurred in a  smaller size ( length too short & toes hit edge) than I typically wear as well as the size that was appropriate for my foot length. 
These seem to be Wide and high volume overall so may not work well if your Heels are Not wide.
review.name: returned  - Significant Heel Slip
comment: I had the same problem with the CX238 shoes which have the same upper. You can try MX332 - they have carbon enforced heel.

review.reviewBody: I bought these to use with my road bike riding as I am getting tired of walking in road bike shoes!  I am getting older, my balance in walking with road bike shoes is getting worse!!  First time out we did a 45 mile ride....the first 10 miles I was just getting used to the different cleats, not really concentrating on the shoe itself........then I realized how comfortable the shoes are!  Walking in to a convenience store was like walking in the most comfortable street shoes I own!  I also need the extra with because of bunions and these fit the bill.  My road shoes are also Lake's with Boa's......they are super for adjusting and having plenty of room to get the shoes on & off easily!  I also have a mountain bike where I can use the same shoe for either bike!  You won't be disappointed in having this shoe!
review.name: Very Comfortable!  Great Construction

name: MX238 Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Fits in the overhead bins on flights and can pack about 5 days worth of clothes. Good, strong, waterproof material. Should be the last carry on I ever buy.
review.name: Built to last.

review.reviewBody: First trip went great, there is alot of side pockets. Size is good for a 3-4 day trip, did wish there was space for an extra pair of shoes.
review.name: Would purchase again

review.reviewBody: Awesome bags. Are excellent for travel and warranty can't be beat.
review.name: Best luggage

review.reviewBody: I used this bag for my travel to Ecuador, and all along inside the country. Being in a rainy and cold, mountainous region with a bunch of nature visits, this bag withstood all. As a bonus, I got this bag checked both ways, and it has zero damage or scuff marks. Protected all my valuables and kept them dry.
review.name: Functional, attractive, & Durable

review.reviewBody: Really a great product. Only have a few trips in the bag but it holds a good amount of gear, nice organization and pockets and the laptop sleeve is a nice bonus for trips where I need the laptop but don't need a separate laptop bag to lug it around.
review.name: Great suitcase!

review.reviewBody: Love my new carry on suitcase, I recently traveled to Florida for 4 days and it fit everything...including some new clothing I purchased while on the trip. The suitcase is very classy and modern looking but also seems to be very sturdy and well made. I highly recommend!
review.name: Perfect Carry On For Shorter Trips!

review.reviewBody: I've used this half a dozen times since purchase, and I'm very satisfied with the product. The capacity is excellent for the 22" and I like that stanchions take up minimal amount of space, enabling for more storage space. The red wheels make the bag easy to identify if checking bag for flights. Durable, quality materials; love that the handles are on all 4 sides, and there are plenty of pockets for laptop and other items if you don't want to carry a backpack on trips. Honestly, exceeded expectations.
review.name: Good capacity. Nice pockets. Well made.

review.reviewBody: I feel it's a quality product but it was still too small for a carry on. I wanted the 28. But for someone looking for a smaller carry-on is beautiful. It doesn't disappoint. I did return to get the 28
review.name: Nice smaller carryon.

review.reviewBody: I am a big fan of Northface luggage. I would never buy anything else. I bought this online and was expecting a basic carry-on like my last one. The pictures did not show any of the details of the bag and do not give an accurate description of this awesome bag! This is a big improvement from their prior carry-ons. It has a nice sleeve for the laptop. A nice cushion pocket for your wallet and valuables. It has extra pockets inside the case. Very roomy on the inside as compared to other carry-ons. The case is very well built, the wheels are top-notch, the handle is nice and long and durable. I give this a 10 star!
review.name: The pictures do not do this luggage justice

review.reviewBody: More space than expected, great handles(s) placement on every side, good pockets so you don't need to potentially bring a backpack (on business), love the red wheels and stanchions which make it easy to spot in case of need to check in luggage on a plane trip. Just awesome. Considering buying a second one. Perfect for 1-3 night business trips.
review.name: Considering buying a second one.

review.reviewBody: I have normal to narrow shoulders, but the shoulders and chest on this jacket are extremely tight and constricting. I can't raise my arms above my head. I even sized up from S to M so I would have room for layers. The bottom ended up flaring and looking huge while shoulders are still wayyy too tight, I want to be able to move!
review.name: So tight in the shoulders!

review.reviewBody: Was looking for something slimming and I found it! It is really comfortable but really nice lines and made very well.  I am very happy with this jacket.  thank you, JaniceS
review.name: REALLY PRETTY ON

review.reviewBody: I purchased this raincoat (great quality), in a navy blue (nice color), size Large (good fit, 5' 6" 170lb). I am returning it because (1) the overhanging hood partially obstructs the ahead above view of something like a low hanging branch when hiking and (2) I do not like the bold white capital letter HH logo being so prominently placed at the front on the hood (ie smack dab on one's forehead). Compare to Black Diamond women's blue ink waterproof shell.
review.name: Good quality. Deal breaker logo on hood.

review.reviewBody: Ive been in the hunt for a good rain jacket for so long. This is perfection. The hood has great coverage and it sits below my bum and is form fitting but not tight. I bought a Large and Im 510 and the arm length is right where it needs to be. I usually find that rain coats are really short on the arms for me. I could not recommend this jacket more!!!
review.name: Fantastic!!!

hasVariant.description: Buy the Vittoria Terreno Dry G2.0 TLR Tubeless Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Terreno Dry G2.0 TLR Tubeless Tire
review.reviewBody: I bought 2 - one for front tire, one for back. Front tire went on with little effort and works great (5 stars). The back tire was _way_ too tight for the rim and took forever to get it on. Once on, I tried taking it off again since I use tubes and wanted to see if it would be feasible to change a flat on the road - yeah, there's no way I could - so it remains off (0 stars). Average = 3 stars.
review.name: tolerence out of spec?

review.itemreviewed: Terreno Dry G2.0 TLR Tubeless Tire
review.reviewBody:
I really want to like this tire and have just started riding it. However, it is the most difficult tire to mount that I have encountered -- and I have been riding road/gravel tubeless since the the beginning of tubeless era. You will need to use all your tricks and have massive grip strength to seat this. Even after pre-stretching it. A pro mechanic friend has a similar experience.

It may also be sensitive to how much rim tape you use. On a HED Emporia wheel with 25 mm inner width, I found it impossible to mount the tire when using the recommended 27mm wide Stans rim tape but only nigh impossible with 25mm wide tape. That said, once the tire is on the rim, it held air for over two weeks without sealant.

When testing the transition between pavement and dirt, this tire doesn't hook up as well as the other tires I have used like the Panaracer or Donnelly X'Plor MSO.  It is noticeably more comfortable than these tires, though I am running a bit wider size with this tire and lower pressure (45 psi per the Enve tire pressure chart for my weight).
review.name: Nigh impossible to mount

review.itemreviewed: Terreno Dry G2.0 TLR Tubeless Tire
review.reviewBody:
Have these in 29x2.1 on a custom built Otso Waheela C.  Aired up and installed nicely, though can't recall whether I needed the LBS to blow them onto the ED silver Emporium wheels.   I don't recall them being difficult, like most wider rubber, so they've been installed for awhile now - 2 years I think.

First had 27.5 Soma Cazaderos on this bike and they were wicked fast and agile, even at 50mm.   But the Terreno's have been a very stable, reliable tire, up until the past month.   They have ridden great on pavement, thick gravel, pea gravel, hard pack and even a little mud.  They're not fast, but they are pretty sticky.  I really loved them after they settled in.  And they didn't let go once not once in rain or wet pavement.   

But couldn't be more irritated that the rear just will not hold air and I cannot find a puncture.  I am flat after 20 minutes.   So am looking to replace for IRC Boken Double Cross in 42mm.   Should be fast enough and stable/agile for where I ride to be a solid upgrade.
review.name: GREAT TIRES before rear flats every ride

review.itemreviewed: Terreno Dry G2.0 TLR Tubeless Tire
review.reviewBody: Going flat daily from holes in the casing/sidewalls. Haven't even taken them out yet. Anyone else having this issue? Bummer...
review.name: Maybe A Bad Batch?

name: Terreno Dry G2.0 TLR Tubeless Tire

review.name: Works but not for my 29er
comment:
Thank you for sharing your thoughts on the Thule RideAlong Low Saddle Adapter. 
The Thule RideAlong Low Saddle Adapter is not intended to change the fit requirements of the Thule RideAlong child bike seat. The change in shape from the standard attachment allows for more clearance around lower-slung saddles. Thule still recommends comparing your bike's measurements to the compatibility measurements listed in the user manual for the Thule RideAlong to confirm a safe fit with the bike seat.

review.reviewBody: I purchased the Thule RideAlong Lite for my toddler. When I tried to install it on my mountain bike (trek with 29" tires), it rubbed against my back tire. The description of this part is not good, but it does raise the RideAlong Lite another 3-4" above the tire and solved the problem. This part should come standard with the RideAlong.
review.name: Necessary Piece

review.reviewBody: We bought the regular saddle and it did not work for our bike but then we got this one and it was the perfect fit! We are glad we found it!
review.name: Perfect fit

review.reviewBody: Easy to order the correct part. Great website. Super fast shipping. Fit perfect! Thanks.
review.name: Great service

review.reviewBody: Most bikes don't need this adapter but if you do it's great. It feels very safe and secure.
review.name: Easy to use

review.reviewBody: This adapter should be the one that comes with the child seat. Works great for our GT mountain bikes!
review.name: Exactly what you need!

review.reviewBody: Bought one in black and liked it so much I picked up one in teal and another in blue. Not every day I find a jersey that fits and looks great.
review.name: Fits great and looks fantastic

review.reviewBody: Runs a little large. I had ordered a large that was a bit too tight. I went for an XL. Its the loosest XL I have in the collection. Might be the cut. Other than that typical Castelli materials and features.
review.name: Castelli Attacco Ltd Edition

review.reviewBody: I bought the darker color black grey version of this jersey and it is a light, breathable jersey. One of my favorite summer jerseys that I like to wear with Castelli Aero bibs. I like the design and is a go to for warm humid and hot days. Castelli runs small so they are a hit and miss for me as their sizing changes depending on which product and where it was made.
review.name: One of my favorite jerseys

review.reviewBody:
Yes, this jersey is longer in the torso and on the back flap. But for all my fellow 64 all torso brothers out therethis is your jersey. 

Bought two!
review.name: Long Torso? Try this

review.reviewBody: I have many Castelli products. Jerseys, jackets, bibs etc... My sizing has been pretty close to accurate but this one was way too small. I'm 6'1", 200 lbs and my jerseys have been XL. This one was skin tight! I'm going to have to return for the XXL.  I ordered the light blue one thinking it would look like the photos. This jersey is NOT WHITE!  It is almost a mint green and blue. I'll have to get a different color too.
review.name: I find it to run QUITE SMALL!

review.reviewBody: I ordered a couple of these jerseys and neither one of them are close to the description. My jerseys are way to big and the jersey is very hot when I am wearing it, this is the last jersey I would wear on a hot day, even with the mesh panels I am riding in the morning in the garage on the trainer and after about 10 minutes I'm so hot I have to remove the jersey. I have bought Castelli for years but this year is the last Castelli kits I will purchase. There products are getting to inconsistent for me.I will stick with Santini, Giordana, and Al.
review.name: Way to long and way to baggy

review.reviewBody: If you have an athletic build, this is not the jersey for you. XXL was way too tight across 44" chest and had a super loose club fit around the waist. Seems to match the size chart that assumes XXL people have large waists. I could not lift my arms in this jersey and had trouble getting it off. The torso is also short and the fabric is very warm.
review.name: Not for athletic build

review.reviewBody:
This is the first Castelli product that I have purchased and absolutely love it. I noticed the Presenters on the awesome Youtube channel GCN (Global Cycling Network) were all wearing Castelli products so I figured I would try one as well. Now I'm completely hooked! The overall quality is excellent. The colors are super bright, crisp and sharp. Just a really nice jersey. Before discovering Castelli, I wore the usual local bike shop products which were usually just ok.. This is the good stuff! As to fit. I really like it.. A nice snug aero fit. Not loose or baggy. Snug fit in the sleeves as well but to me very comfortable. I would highly recommend this jersey and Castelli products. 
Cheers!
review.name: First Castelli Product Purchase

review.reviewBody: I am a clydesdale guy who is struggling with finding the good fitting kit. This one is good quality and it fits perfectly. I ordered size larger, as I always do with Castelli.
review.name: Nice shirt for a good price

review.reviewBody: Love the Jersey. It runs a touch big which is great for my long rides where I want easy access to the pockets and Aero is not the primary concern.
review.name: Great kit!

name: Attacco Limited Edition Jersey - Men's

review.reviewBody:
My waders took 10 days to arrive and the order was incomplete, no wading belt, no tags etc. I sat on chat because it is a Saturday for over 5 minutes and gave up. Then I called the 800# and got an offshore person  who was struggling to help me. I've spot thousands of dollars on snowboards, fly rods, clothing, gear with Backcountry but over the last year at least I have noticed more and more problems ordering from them. I should have ordered direct from Patagonia.

In regard to these swiftcurrent waders they are a decent product but not as durable or as well built as my swiftcurrent wading pants. No big deal they still get the job done and they are lightweight which is good for warmer weather.
review.name: Backcountry is backsliding

review.reviewBody: Bought them and returned right away. I listened to the expert gear head sizing was way off and shipping was a nightmare. Backcountry will take your money in a heartbeat but getting the refund back is a joke.
review.name: Yeah, no.

description: Buy the Platypus Push-Pull Cap SoftBottle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Push-Pull Cap SoftBottle
hasVariant.description: Buy the Platypus Push-Pull Cap SoftBottle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have the older, better version of these.  They're probably +/-8 years old, have never leaked and were a better design.  I'll find another brand to replace these with.
review.name: 2 out of 3 leaked on day one

review.reviewBody:
I have been using a variety of soft water bottles for several years. It all started with me wanting to minimize the volume in my day pack, so the self-reducing size of this bottle was a no brainer. I do treat them a bit more gently than my solid blocky water bottles, but they last for many years and Ive never had a sudden catastrophic seam failure that soaked my pack.

I prefer 2 or 3 half-liter bottles, that way I can make one electrolyte water and the other(s) plain water. I prefer the push-pull tops even though (as has been previously mentioned) they can be hard to open/close. But I consider that to be a feature not a bug b/c it insures the cap is less likely to open on its own inside my pack. 

Do bigger bottles have their place? Of course, especially for screwing on a water filter, but Im always going to have a least three of these softies in my rotation. Recommended!
review.name: A Unique and Functional Water Bottle Option

review.reviewBody: Hello, can I have ask? It is possible to fill the bottle (SoftBottle 1L) with hot water?
review.name: Hot watter

review.reviewBody:
Its just what the doctor ordered. Fits my existing filter. I wish i could of repaired the leaks in my old softbottle. I hate thowing out things that should be repairable. 
But the replacement was affordable i hope to get afew years out of it.
review.name: new Platypuss softbottle

review.reviewBody: j'ai deux gourdes Platypus quipes de bouchons push and pull tellement durs qu'inutilisables sauf avec des pinces!!!
review.name: Push and pull : Dangereux pour les dents!!!

review.reviewBody: I've been using these collapsible water bottles for years only replacing them when I've lost them. They last forever, fit in anything, weigh almost nothing when empty, and I've never had any problems with them, UNTIL... I couldn't get the closure cap bottles locally any more. I bought 3 bottles with push/pull type caps and every one of them leaks terribly. The threading is already warped from trying to close it fully enough to stop it from leaking. It gets all over the inside of my bag and leaked hand filtered water I filled it with during a backpacking trip into my pack and then again all over my tent when I knocked it over accidentally during the night. Do not buy the push/pull caps. It says it all in the name. Buy the "Closure" cap.
review.name: New push/pull caps all leak

review.reviewBody: This is my second soft bottle. I only replaced the first one because I lost it. The push pull cap is a bit stiff but I think thats just mine. Highly recommend! People always seem skeptical, until they see you fold it up and put it in your pocket or bag when its empty. Several of my friends have seen mine and have ordered them.
review.name: Its catching on.

review.reviewBody: Keep them in the freezer for storage, when not in use. You can boil them as well. Great for the outdoors. Watch out for eukaryotic organisms, though. Cheers.
review.name: Jazz

review.reviewBody: I have been using Platypus water bottles for about 25 yrs. They are so handy - weigh almost nothing, fit in a purse and go flat when empty. hasVariant.description: Buy the Blackburn Chamber Tubeless Floor Pump online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Has worked well for me inflating Maxxis, Bontrager, Conti, Schwalbe MTB (mostly 29x2.35) and Conti Road tires with tubeless beads on tubeless rims.  I've removed the valve cores to increase the airflow.  Usually seats the beads in one go. Sometimes have to top off a bit with the pump to seat the beads.  

Nice for road trips when away from the air compressor.  Gauge and chuck are nice.  Gauge agrees well with a standalone SKS digital gauge.

For race support it'd be nice if the reservoir could be pressurized and sealed off, ready to go in the pit while still being able to use the pump.  Separate bottle and pump are better setup for that scenario.
review.name: Has worked well for me so far.

name: Chamber Tubeless Floor Pump

review.reviewBody: These pants run large so size down and they will be perfect. Love the material and the wide waistband. However, there is a drawstring in the waistband that is anchored down low-so if you use it to tighten the waist it creates a weird bulge in the wide waistband.
review.name: Great material, run large, odd drawstring

review.reviewBody: Fits great, I can wear them for all types of activities
review.name: Love this pant

review.reviewBody: Theres a big difference between to M and S sized pants. I first ordered th M as I have other MHW pants in M that I love the fit. In this style, the M is very large. So I ordered a S. Its much smaller - especially in the length and waist. I was very disappointed
review.name: Hard fit

review.reviewBody:
I've been a loyal fan of Mountain Hardware Dynama pants for years, and they have always been my go-to for just about everything. However, I'm quite disappointed with the new design. While I appreciate that they are still wearable, I noticed that this latest pair runs a bit larger than my previous ones, making them look quite baggy on me. 

One of the most baffling changes is the removal of the functional pocket on the left thigh, which was perfect for holding a phone. Instead, they've added a non-functional pocket on the right side that can barely fit a driver's license. This change results in three pockets on one side, which, when used, makes the pants uneven and causes them to pull down on that side.

Whoever thought this redesign was a good idea clearly didn't consider functionality. I'm keeping my new pair and hoping for the best, but I sincerely hope Mountain Hardware reconsiders these changes in future versions.
review.name: Disappointing Redesign: Larger Fit and Less Functional Pockets

review.reviewBody: I love these pants. I wear them to the gym over my tights, I hike in them. Very comfortable!
review.name: Highly recommended!

review.reviewBody: I have several pairs of these pants, and this pair seems to run a bit larger than the others, which is a problem because these pants usually bag out after a couple of months. They are wearable, but they look big on me. I will keep them and hope for the best.
review.name: Runs large

review.reviewBody: I love the Dynama ankle pants. They have great fit, comfort, and function. I just didn't like the gray compared to some of the other colors.
review.name: Great pant, meh color

review.reviewBody: I really like the Dynama Ankle Pant. These are great go anywhere and do anything pants. They are a good fit and super comfortable. The moon blue color is a bit odd though. It's not quite blue enough to escape being gray. I would have liked it to be bluer. Still, I thought this color was nicer than the simple gray, and so I kept these.
review.name: Great pant, ok color

review.reviewBody: Love these pants. Light weight, comfortable, slim styling. Go anywhere except fancy. Nice pockets. I hope they have similar in a winter pant. But warning see capris review on sizing.
review.name: Great comfy casual pant

name: Dynama Ankle Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: I dont have large hands. I typically wear a size medium glove. Im also a single finger breaker, which means I like to have as much of my hand around the grip at all times. While I havent tried them all, Ive tried a lot of grips and these are my favorite. Ive had these on several bikes and have gone through a few pair and will continue using them as they are everything I want in a grip. Durable, comfortable, and light. Will purchase again and again until they stop making them or I become aware of something better.
review.name: Perfect Grips For Me.

review.reviewBody: These are my favorite all time grips.  They're great for trail riding but really shine at the bike park.  After a few days at the bike park, my hands feel better with these than with most other grips I've used.  Bigger diameter, but with the squish in the ribbing, they don't feel as chunky as other larger grips.
review.name: Favorite grips

review.reviewBody: Got these for my specialized epic HT.  I love them.  My hands are a bit bigger so they gave me the extra room for grip.  Pretty soft and feel great on the hands, and they look rad on my bike!
review.name: Great grip

name: Knuckleduster Grip

review.reviewBody: I ordered this with high hopes to have a bottle mount below my downtube for bikepacking. After research and finding this product here, I am reporting that not once but twice was I sent this product missing the straps to keep it on the bike. Either someone stole it during packaging or it fell off which is hard to believe. Either way, I have gone back and forth with backcountry on replacements. Both times missing a strap...tried calling Wolf Tooth and you can't reach them. If you order this be aware they ship missing a strap and you have to go through a return claim. Don't ship back the old one since you will need the strap from it. Kind of pointless this process...used to be a fan of the Backcountry warranty. Now its a hassle.
review.name: Missing 1 out of the 2 straps...

name: B-RAD Everywhere Base

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Fleece Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great product. The perfect addition for my bag during this year backcountry hunt. Super light weight and adds tones of warmth and comfort to your sleep system. Two thumbs up.
review.name: Reactor Fleece Sleeping Bag Liner

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Fleece Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely love my Sea to summit camping supplies in reactor fleece, sleeping bag liner color orange mummy with drawcord. It keeps you warm in temperatures below 0. It is so comfortable and yes, it really does. Keep you warm extremely warm. I would definitely recommend this product. I would definitely purchase this product again.
review.name: Love this easy heat accessory!

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Fleece Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This fleece sleeping bag liner is nice. Used it this past weekend camping. The overnight temp was in the 40s so not warm enough to use the liner by itself. On a hot summer day you might be able to. So I paired this with my sleeping bag and it felt like I was wrapped in a blanket. Nice and warm, but not too hot to the point I was sweating.
review.name: Warm and comfy

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Fleece Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This liner works great as a both a light summer bag and a liner bag in colder weather. Its compact and warm. I take it on both kayak touring and backpacking trips.
review.name: Great dual use bag

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Fleece Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Warm and cozy! This fleece liner is a little on the thin side but its still warm and Im sure would pack a punch inside a sleeping bag!

Im using mine as a comfort item for when I feel overstimulated Im able to cocoon myself and feel better after warming up and feeling safe in my cocoon lol
review.name: Warm and cozy

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Fleece Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Sea to Summit Reactor Fleece Sleeping Bag Liner is a fantastic product and a much needed one for camping. It provides extra warmth on chilly nights, extending the usability of sleeping bag into colder seasons. The fleece material is so soft and cozy. its lightweight and packs down making it easy to transport. I used it when I went camping last weekend and i will say , this will be a best investment for those who go camping. Love mine.
review.name: Best investment

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Fleece Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really satisfied with the feel of the material, the durability, and effectiveness of the bag liner. I got the extreme version because I wanted to be able to pair it with my 20 bag and get more range and extend its life. I also planned to use the bag liner as a hot summer night sleeping bag. Its also much easier to wash than a sleeping bag. So its nice to use on the trip. Turns out my favorite use for it is as a summer bag. Its very small when packed compared to a sleeping bag and works well to keep you comfortable on a backpacking or bike-packing trip on warm nights
review.name: Highly satisfied

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Fleece Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great compactable mummy liner! This is an waffle like texture and super warm for for insulating your sleeping bag. Very versatile for all sizes and have great cords to adjust size around head and feet. Perfect for backpacking and camping.
review.name: Great liner!

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Fleece Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The reactor fleece sleeping bag liner is very soft even though its not what I was expecting I figured it would be like a silky material but it was more like cotton but other than that it could fit like 2 people in it! And it definitely still keeps you warm! I would still recommend!
review.name: Reactor fleece sleeping bag liner

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Fleece Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is perfect for a chilly day at camping! It packs small and is very lightweight! I would recommend it for someone who likes to camp in chilly climates
review.name: Warm and cozy

name: Reactor Fleece Mummy + Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner

review.reviewBody: I bought this pack after looking for a few years for a new daypack for long hikes.  I needed something that would be comfortable against my back (I have a short torso), have easy accessibility from a few entry points of the pack, and zippered compartments on the belt.  I couldn't be happier with this pack, and people ask me about it on the trail, too.  I can access things from the bottom and top, there's safe places for my car key, a great sleeve for my water pouch and tube, and an outside compartment where I can stuff one or two things I might need as temperature becomes variable.  Very happy.
review.name: Best day pack for long hikes

name: Trail Pro SL 34L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody: Yes, these pants have a snug fit, but they have plenty of stretch.  I carefully read many reviews on these and found that compared to other soft shell pants I have from Mountain Hardware and TNF, these have both structure and stretch.   I could easily pair a spandex baselayer underneath, however I do not believe these would be warm enough for sub 20 degree temps.  They would pair nicely with TNF Nuptse Jacket, especially with the side zipper, which I find stylish.
review.name: They stretch!

review.reviewBody: Wayy too small! Nice pants but need to size up 2 sizes.
review.name: Cute but small

review.reviewBody: Fits extremely small but other than that I love the fit and how streamlined they are!
review.name: Small fit but love the pants

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Cute, SUPER tight. I'm normally a size 2, needed size 6
review.name: Cute, not the most functional

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Run super small. I ordered my regular size and couldn't even pull them up forget about bending over! Not for me they will be going back!
review.name: Runs very small

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I did not buy these pants to ski. I usually ski in very cold places so I prefer thicker and looser pants for that. I did get them for all other cold weather and snow situations. They look GREAT, and fit great (if you size up). I am 5'7, 145 lbs. I have a long torso, slim waist and wider hips with a big butt. I am usually a size 6 in tops and 8 in pants (Size 8 fit my hips and is usually a bit to big for my waist) After reading the reviews here I ordered a size 12. They fit perfectly. Just barely loose on the waist (but that gives space for tucking in thick baselayers tops) and perfect on the hips. I could have gotten a size 10 but I suspect that would give me a flattened butt. These are perfect. So like most reviews recommend: size up 2 sizes.
review.name: I love them. Size up!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I loved it! It is very tight and fashion for skiing. Very fashion. Loved it.
review.name: Stylish and sophisticated!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very flattering fit. Seam in the backside can be improved to make the booty even more flattering (take note of how Fabletics designs their legging). There is no guard on the bottom of the pants on the inside, not sure if this would be an issue later on. Definitely size up 2 sizes if you want to wear a base layer. Otherwise it is skin tight!
review.name: Very slimming fit!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these pants -- incredibly comfortable and wonderful for spring skiing. At 5"1 the short were great.
review.name: Great pants -- petite!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These pants run small! very cute though just make sure to size up.
review.name: RUNS VERY SMALL SIZE UP!

name: Snoga Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: I bought these pants in November 2023 and have put about 60 days on them with about 60% backcountry and 40% resort. I freaking loved them for 2 weeks and then holes started appearing in the crotch of my pants. I now have about a dozen holes that appeared out of nowhere (I did not get hit in the crotch) one of the holes is also a 2 inch seam that exploded. The fabric also is basically degrading everywhere. When I went back to Patagonia they told me it would take 8-10 weeks since they need to send them out. Dont waste your money. Purchase something that will last.
review.name: Great pants for 10 days

review.reviewBody: Ive been wearing chacos for 20 years and this sole specifically is the best in the game. As a boater and avid fly fisher over burned through simms and korker soles over the years and they in no way compare with the grip of the fishing companies. On a recent trip to MT I regularly op-ed for these wade fishing on snot rocks over my much more protected fishing boots. Worth every cent for the upgrade.
review.name: Amazing grip

review.reviewBody: Great shoes for the rivers up in Montana. I have dedicated these for only boating. Hope these bottoms become an option on the customizer in the future!
review.name: Great river shoes

review.reviewBody: Hiked the first 20 miles from the Columbia River to Cannon Beach, Oregon with them. Great traction, comfort, and support. Excellent on sand and in water.
review.name: My new hiking sandal

review.reviewBody: First pair of Chacos! Suffice it to say, dang sorry I waited. Only issue I have is length of adjustment strap. Drags when adjusted to fit my foot properly. Will gladly accept potential solutions. Otherwise? Awesome sandals.
review.name: Great Sandals.
comment: Thanks for the great feedback John!

review.reviewBody: I love the feel and look of my Chacos. They adjust to the perfect fit.
review.name: Perfect fit/feel
comment: Thank you for sharing your feedback!

review.reviewBody: Excellent upgrade with the return of the Vibram sole. It looks like this sole will be unique to this new sandal, based on the notched design. Put maybe 50 miles of trail on these and typical Chaco comfort and quality. Some boulder hopping on a mountain trout stream, too The front part of the strap seems to be a softer webbing than other Zs I have worn, perhaps in the name of comfort and ease of slide adjustment? It has caused some loosening of the straps, I think. The downturned buckle and loose strap end are magnets for fly line-otherwise these are pretty perfect for me.  Would be nice to have the US made option on these.
review.name: Worthy upgrade.

review.reviewBody: Vibram outsoles rule! Grippy when wet and an excellent color scheme.
review.name: So good

review.reviewBody: Love them. Very comfortable on and off river and really are quite grippy as advertised.
review.name: Great pair of sandals!

review.reviewBody: The Rapid Pro is an excellent sandal using the same great strap system as other Chaco sandals. The sole with the Vibram hiking outsole provides really good grip for all types of terrain. The RP has become my daily wear for the summer (and the tan lines on my feet prove it). Very glad I made the purchase.
review.name: Rapid Pro is excellent

name: Rapid Pro Sandal - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Tenaya Inti Climbing Shoe online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I started climbing 5 years ago at 47 years old. My first pair of shoes were Tarantulas. When those wore, I stumbled across a pair of Verticks, which I believe was the predecessor of the Tenaya Tanta. Those were a big improvement over the Tarantulas. My next pair was the Tenaya Inti. Sized 1/2 size smaller than my street shoe, they were great right out of the box. They are very comfortable and the sensitivity was a game changer for me. It's made it hard to use anything else. 

While the Intis were getting resoled, I tried Evolv Supras and the Tenaya Masai. Both of those are touted for their edging power. That may be true, but they felt like climbing in ski boots, especially the Supras. I found it hard to trust my feet when I couldn't feel the edges. I've tried on lots of other shoes from all the players, but nothing has the sensitivity of the Inti. As an analogy, It's like trail running in a minimalist shoe - my favorite is the Altra Superior 4 -versus a beefy trail runner. If that sounds like your cup of tea, try the Inti. I'm now on my second pair.
review.name: THE climbing shoe for me

review.reviewBody: Great shoe if you want to get something with more quality then a standard beginner shoe. Half a size down from my street shoe size was a tight performance fit for me.
review.name: Solid intermediate shoe

name: Inti Climbing Shoe

review.name: Reliable and comfy

review.reviewBody: Cool shoes but the outside of the shoe dig into my ankles on both feet which makes them uncomfortable to wear for long periods of time

review.itemreviewed: Sertig II Low Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: First impressions of this shoe was based purely on looks for me, and many friends have agreed with more compliments on this shoe than any other I've owned in a long time.  My next stage was wearing them for travel & regular everyday athletic shoe use, and they're great for that.  Most recently, I took them hiking in the wilderness with a small pack, very confidence inspiring traction with the "sidewall" lugs.  Next stop, backpacking for a few days.
review.name: Comfortable, light, great traction & good-looking!

review.itemreviewed: Sertig II Low Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love the look of these and they have a high quality feel to them. They are a little narrow (I typically wear wide size) but not narrow enough to bother my feet over a full day wear. Part of the sole that extends to the front of the toe seems to be separating from the shoe a bit but it hasn't gotten worse over time. The sole has great traction and feel, almost like little cleats. Great buy.
review.name: Great look, good feel

review.itemreviewed: Sertig II Low Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Nice design and color choices. The size match what I typically use on other brand shoes. Great grip and breathable. I have wide feet so this shoes were a bit narrow for me on the toe box. The sole platform is a bit stiff compare to other shoes like the Salomon Speedcross or an Altra shoe. 
If you have wide foot this is NOT the shoe for you, otherwise buy away! 
I mainly use them for gym sessions or light hiking.
review.name: Good Shoe

review.itemreviewed: Sertig II Low Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Love the design and overall quality of the shoes but it's much narrower than I expected.  Shoe laces are very good quality and should last a long time.  I would strongly recommend paying close attention to your shoe width requirements because this shoe is definitely on the narrow side of the expected width.
review.name: Snug Fit

review.itemreviewed: Sertig II Low Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great fit and design while providing great grip on the mountain trails
review.name: Great looking & functional

name: Sertig II Low Trail Running Shoe - Men's

 Highly recommended!

review.reviewBody: A cute everyday vest for layering. Lightweight. I got it in navy so that it can be worn casually with just about any outfit.

review.reviewBody: This vest is great and I wish I had gotten it sooner! My only frustration is that I have an XL in one of the Cotopaxi jackets (can't remember the name, but it's reversible and no longer in production). So I assumed I'd need an XL in the vest, but it was HUGE. Even over a sweatshirt, huge. Luckily I was easily able to exchange for L, which fits much better, but is still roomy. If you want this to go over a base layer, I'd definitely size down. If you want it over a heavy midlayer, go with your normal clothing size. Just don't go with your Cotopaxi jacket size!
review.name: Perfect weight and features

review.reviewBody: This vest is warm, light weight, and fits well as a layering piece. I love it!
review.name: Amado Fleece Vest

review.reviewBody:
Love this vest! I did buy the dark blue color, which is a little on the "boring" side for Cotopaxi, but I thought it would be nice to pair with all of my other bright colored clothing. Runs true to size. I wear between a Medium and sometimes a Large for oversized fit/to compensate for my broad shoulders, but I found the Medium comfortable with a little wiggle room for some lightweight layers. 

If you want to wear it over a heavier layer, maybe size up? 

I would like to get another color at some point!
review.name: Great lightweight vest

review.reviewBody: This vest fits perfectly and is the perfect weight to add a little warmth or to layer. I love it!
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: I bought the Amado Fleece Vest - Women's in a slate grey color and have been wearing it inside, and outside under a coat. It is comfortable and just the right weight.
review.name: Fleece vest

review.reviewBody:
Pros: Very soft, lightweight, and beautiful color (I got the blue). 
Cons: I wish there were zippered pockets and was a bit thicker material.
review.name: Really Enjoy!

review.itemreviewed: Mille GT Winter Bib Tight - Men's
review.reviewBody: I was in search of a good quality winter bib tight and spend literally days of looking thru, reading, eye "inspecting" products and options. Boy am I glad I DID spend the time and research. I'm a "newbie" in the road cycling and proud of it :) To the point. My Oh My-those pants, bib, tights, whatever word fits your language, are absolutely amazing. Superb. I did try another popular brand, of which I own shorts, not even close. The ASSOS are absolute best quality made, material, feel, durability, fit (yes, smaller than actual size, buy a size up). Most importantly- THEY ARE WARM. No question about it. That other brand I was talking about was in the Same category as the ASSOS, again not even close in fit or protection from the cold. Even extra superlative- you can wear them in super chilly winter windy conditions, and at the same time, if it warms up through the day, you are not boiling. Of course we are not talking summer/spring weather. I wear them in low 30-40 very windy also, no fear of freezing. Winter bib they are, will keep you warm and is worth the investment. Absolutely the best decision I made this winter on warm gear. Ride on ASSOS saved my A&0$ from freezing :)
review.name: Unbelievable How good it is, I love them

name: Mille GT Winter Bib Tight - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought the Rapid Gutter High to allow clearance to open my Jeep Wrangler Unlimiteds Sky One-Touch Top to open. Worked perfectly.
review.name: Perfect for Jeep Wrangler Sky One-Touch Top

review.reviewBody:
I needed a rack to allow use of my 2020 Jeep Wrangler One Touch Sky Top.  The 8" High Foot is the perfect height to allow safe retraction of the power top.  The knob style tightening system allows me to put the rack on/off very quickly, but I usually leave the rack on most of the time.  

I am using the High Gutter Foot with the Wing Blade Evo in black. The rack produces very little wind noise at high speeds, no whistling whatsoever.  

Obviously, the rack stands a bit taller than other racks, but it is not so tall that it looks weird. If I don't like the look when there is no cargo, I can take them off in minutes.

It is a bit on the expensive side, but I got exactly what I needed/wanted.

Very happy with the product.
review.name: Works with Wrangler One Touch Sky Top

review.reviewBody: I purchased the rapid gutter 8" for my square drop camper so that I could mount a batwing for protection.
review.name: Rapid Gutter 8"
