review.itemreviewed: Helios III Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I've purchased 2 pairs of Helios 3s over the past 4 years. They're incomparable when it comes to comfort. I absolutely love them and wear them pretty much every day as a "gym shoe". Unfortunately the main issue with them is I think they are mislabeled, as everytime I take them out on the trails they simply don't hold up. 
Think of this shoe as a Nike Free type of shoe with the grip of a trail runner. They are incredibly lightweight and comfortable but this also comes with the sacrifice of limited support and almost zero cushion. As a result of these aspects you will feel every rock and root throughout your trail runs - and the upper ankle support just isn't there for longer distance runs. I actually think this shoe would be way better branded as a "trainer" or gym shoe. Like I said - I use it as a gym shoe everyday (I'm a PE teacher),  so if you are going to buy it expect comfort but definitely don't use it out on the trails it won't hold up and you WILL have sore feet afterwards.
review.name: Trainer Shoe NOT a Trail Runner

review.itemreviewed: Helios III Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
My favorite running shoe of all time. Incredibly light, grippy, comfortable and secure locked in feel, plenty of impact absorbing cushion, but still a good amount of proprioception for avoiding rolled ankles etc. 
And whilst they were always narrow, they seem to be getting more and more narrow over the iterations. My dream is that one day they'll start doing this shoe in a wide. If that happens this will be my ONLY running shoe for trails.
review.name: So frickin' great, but too narrow!

review.itemreviewed: Helios III Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I am on my second pair of these. The La Sportiva Mountain running shoes helped stop my knee pain. I am not a runner. I use these for walking. They are my go to shoe that is used every day. They fit like a glove which feels good. I am going to purchase a half size larger for a little more toe room. Highly recommended.
review.name: Eliminates knee pain

review.itemreviewed: Helios III Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These shoes are lightweight, sturdy, and fast. I've had two pairs of these shoes and just ordered my third due to how good they are. These shoes have a smaller drop, which I personally like for trail running, but they still have plenty of cushion, especially on long downhill stretches. It would be cool if Sportiva made a newer version of these shoes though, with maybe a  slightly stronger rubber compound, or thicker lugs. That being said, I'm still wearing my first pair of these shoes, which have survived two high school XC seasons, and countless miles of trail running, hiking, and bushwhacking while I've been in college for 2 years. As per most Sportiva shoes, they run about half a size too small.
review.name: Sturdy, comfortable, and lightweight

review.itemreviewed: Helios III Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: However, we had to order 1/2 size larger than normal.
review.name: My kid loves these shoes.

review.itemreviewed: Helios III Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Initial review is outstanding comfort and nice low heel to toe drop. Will have to reevaluate after more use. 46.5?s fit perfect in these La Sportiva?s. I have narrow, low-volume feet and 12.5?s fit me well in most anything.
review.name: Excellent!

review.itemreviewed: Helios III Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I got these Shoes 3 weeks ago, and they alredy starting to fall apart.
I only wor them for everyday use, and i didn't run or hiked with them.
In the ankle region the soft material, what makes the shoes more comfortable, looks like i have woren these shoes for 2 years.
The overall quality is also not good at all. 

But still, the shoes are very comfortable
review.name: Very comfortable but...

review.itemreviewed: Helios III Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I never used the Helios 2 but have been using the Helios 1.The Helios 3 is an excellent upgrade. Perfect out of the box. Sizing is the same as Helios 1. Upper and lacing is dialed in better. Better cushioning but still firm. If the sole is more durable, I'll be 100% happy.
review.name: Excellent Upgrade

review.itemreviewed: Helios III Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: The original Helios is my all time favorite trail running shoe.  Bought 6 pair when they went on close out and still have 1 pair left.  Also have 3 pair of Helios SR and just 1 pair of Helios 2.  In it's third generation it feels like La Sportiva melded the fit and excellent laces from the SR with the breathable upper and medium flex of the original Helios.  The original Helios was near perfect.  The only issue for me is that my heels were not fully locked down and the laces were not my favorite.  The Helios 2 had a more narrow fit, good heel lock down, and fixed the lacing system, which all helped, but the show was made more flexible and too soft and minimalist for my liking.  Since the Vertical K was discontinued at that time maybe La Sportive intended the Helios 2 to appeal to fans of the VK.  I run on rutted, rough, rocky trails, and that is where Helios has always shined.  High stack height shoes reduce ground feel and lead to ankle rolls in this type of terrain.  Helios 3 gives the perfect amount of feel underfoot and enough protection.  Gravel was felt too sharply with the Helios 2 but the Helios 3 has been firmed up again underfoot and is fine for running and scrambling over rocks.  I run a lot of hills with uneven terrain and I need to have shoes that keep me stable on uneven ground, and are lightweight.  Durability so far seems on par with Helios SR which I still use in colder weather.  Thank you La Sportiva for making the perfect shoe for technical mountain running.  Fit does run a little small and like all of my La Sportiva shoes I size up 1/2.
review.name: Best rugged terrain shoe - Helios is back!

review.itemreviewed: Helios III Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: My new favorite shoe for hot and dry trails.  It's super light, breathable and cushy underfoot.  You really feel the rebound from the sole and it's joyful to run on hard packed trails that aren't too rocky.  This is my door to trail shoe and what I grab when i want to run fast.  It's also comfortable to wear around town because of the mesh upper and comfortably fit.  I bought this in a 43.5 and my standard size is a 43.0.  I could have gone with the 43.0 if I wanted a precise fit, but I like it in the 43.5 for a little extra width and room for my toes on downhills.
review.name: Love it for hot and dry trails

review.reviewBody: Looked at this coat for a long time before getting it on sale. Im 511 and 167 pounds (size 40 mens suit) and bought a L. It is not roomy so if you want to wear a thick sweater or  plush fleece consider sizing up.  Not in love with the zipper but I have a thing with zippers. It is warm but I dont live in an area where it gets really cold. I was looking for something that would be thorn-resistant but this is not:  so far I havent developed any tears walking through briars, etc. and its a lot better than a down coat with a nylon shell.  Havent been in the rain with it yet; I know you can buy Greenland wax to treat it with to help it shed water.  Looks like it will hold uphope so!
review.name: Meets expectations

review.reviewBody:
This jacket is far and above my most versatile winter jacket. In case BC doesn't list them, my measurements are: 5'11" (180cm), 190lbs (86kg), with a 44" (112cm) chest, wide shoulders with an athletic build. The XL fits like a glove with room for light to mid layers underneath--maybe even a heavy sweater, but I've never needed more than a mid-weight sweater and even then it was too much warmth for me personally. 

I live in the PNW, so city (Portland / Seattle) temperatures don't dip frequently below the 30s F (0 to low negatives C) but heading into the mountains during the winter to snow-shoe or ski, you're in the twenties or the teens (below 0 C). The jacket is elegant enough to go on top of dress clothes for the office, and I also use it as a ski jacket. 

Skiing may not be its best or intended purpose, but I've done it twice and it performed flawlessly both times. All I had underneath was a thin polyester base-layer and a cotton long-sleeve t-shirt, also thin. Even getting blasted by the wind on the chairlifts, I was sweating doing runs--this jacket is that warm. After multiple runs down the mountain, a couple of times I unzipped it completely on the lift to cool down.

I do have a tendency to be hot nearly all the time, however, so others may feel more comfortable with additional layers in colder weather. I rarely, if ever, use hoods, but this hood is large enough to fit over a ski helmet, which I appreciated. I prefer not having drawstrings, but other reviewers have complained about the lack of them. To each their own. 

Even when temperatures crept up a bit and bits of snow melted into the jacket, wetting it at certain spots, I stayed warm and dry. A few minutes out of the elements and the G-1000 fabric dried extremely quickly. I have not waxed this jacket; it is completely original from the factory. The YKK zippers are very smooth and it's possible to operate them even with thicker ski gloves, though with some dexterity. I almost NEVER buy clothes for full-retail, and in full-transparency purchased mine on sale, but this is one of the only pieces in my wardrobe I'd be willing to pay full price for. It's that good.
review.name: Bulletproof

review.reviewBody:
I just got it, so I can't say much as to the longevity of the product. I live in a place with very little precipitation, and water resistance isn't my biggest need (I have a Deb for that).

I'm surprised how light this is compared with a stolen Carhartt parka I had that has since been discontinued. I like the fit, the black can be an outdoors coat, and still double as a coat for more formal days at church with a tie.

I'm leaving 4 stars because I'm 5'11" (180cm), 215 lbs (97kg) with an athletic build, and a 44" (111cm) chest, ordered an XL, and while fit in the chest feels pretty good, if I raise my arms, it's snug in the back, and about 2" (5cm) of my wrist is exposed. It's snug around my backside, but not a bad fit. I actually like that it prevents too much airflow up my midsection. For more active movement, unzipping from the bottom makes it very useable.
review.name: Sleeves are a bit short for big shoulders

review.reviewBody: Bought weeks ago and it's comfortable, flexible, stylish and durable.
review.name: Great travel hiking urban jacket

review.reviewBody: Poor fitment. Ordered a Medium as I had the chance to try on a Skgso in that size and fit well. Ordered the Greenland Winter in M and its too tight at the thighs. Upper body and mid torso is okay as are the arms. Reluctant to exchange for a L as I previously returned a Sormland that was akin to wearing a bed sheet. No idea what is going in with the cuts and sizes frfom Fjallraven but my adice is do not buy unless you can try on the specific jacket you want. Very disappointed.
review.name: Poor fitment

review.reviewBody: I like this jacket and have had it for 3 years. The hood is a deal breaker rendering the jacket unusable for the very reason I bought it. Considering returning or getting rid of the jacket.
review.name: Dealbreaker because of the hood

review.reviewBody:
I love this jacket. It's comfortable, warm, durable, waterproof. It's hefty but not bulky and fits very well. But.. I returned mine because of the hood. It's excessively large. Even while wearing a thick beanie, I could freely turn my neck from side to side inside the hood. Moreover, Even the amphitheatre size wouldn't bother me if there was some way to manage it with the wind, but with every gust my head was uncovered yet again. 

Why Fjallraven could you not have added a drawstring to this? Literally on every other FR jacket, there's a drawstring for the hood. This is such a big design flaw that I'm shocked it was a miss on this manufacturer. 

I am genuinely sad to have to return this jacket. It's almost perfect, but for 350 dollars, the hood was a deal breaker.
review.name: Near perfect but the hood broke the deal

review.reviewBody:
I find the Greenland to be the perfect weight, I usually find winter jackets to be too warm and heavy but the Greenland winter for me the perfect combination, the size is a great fit (I did use the size guide and it was very accurate) and theres enough room to layer up if needed, yet it doesnt look too large if I only have one layer underneath. 
As usual from Fjallraven product quality is fantastic and Im very happy with the coat.
review.name: The perfect combination of warmth and weight.

review.reviewBody:
I bought this as an everyday winter coat for the notoriously windy and cold Chicago winters. I've only used it a few times, but the canvas kept me dry on an especially chilly, rainy day. I would suggest going a size up from what you would normally buy to allow yourself the ability to layer underneath for colder days. In my estimation, the fleece is better than the down version because of its wicking properties and thermoregulation that you don't get with down. It can be worn w/ just a t-shirt on milder days without causing you to sweat. The pockets are large and easy to access w/ the snap buttons, and I love the one on the inside of the jacket to stash my wallet and iPhone. 

My only suggestion to improve this coat would be to move the two hand pockets to the diaphragm area and cant them as you see on a classic pea coat. Additionally, I would like to see some sort of hand warmer material used instead of the canvas.

All in all, an excellent, stylish coat that I look forward to using for many years to come.
review.name: Excellent Coat, a Couple Minor Upgrades Needed

review.reviewBody:
I have 3 fjallraven winter coats currently in use for various things. All fantastic. I bought this for work commute as they dont do many suitable ones in black. 
Not too warm so good fir hopping on snd of the train. 
But had to send this one back as the hood is useless. 
Hood sits too tall and floppy with no adjustment. Eithe falls over your eyes or the cold wind fills it like a sail. 
Adjustment cords would make this a good jacket. And adjustable and removable hood would make this a superb jacket
review.name: Please please please sort the hood out

review.reviewBody: I found this jacket to be true to size (I am 5'6", 125lbs, athletic build and ordered a Small) and a perfect warmth for cold weather activity. It is shorter in the front then the back, which is okay for a functional fit with a climbing harness, but maybe not a stylish fit or for sports where you want the front to be longer to prevent a draft (skiing, backpack). I like the stretch fabric for movement, though it is prone to snagging a bit, and the yellow color is going to get dirty fast. The sleeves are long, which I like for climbing, and the hood easily fits over a helmet. I really wish it had a dual zipper for better harness access.
review.name: Nice jacket!

review.reviewBody: The Factor Hoody works perfectly in a big range of conditions so Im constantly wearing it. Im 59 and 145-150lb and in 2021 I bought size small (my usual size is medium). In the Wasatch its my go to layer for skinning with a synthetic t-shirt base underneath (note: I run cold). On colder days it is an essential part of my layering system. It breathes really well. The waffle fleece keeps it light AND warm. I also love the pockets. They are so handy and perfectly placed, including the little chest pocket. The jacket is an awesome length in waist and arms. I find a lot of womens athletic gear is a bit short. I love it so much, and it fits so well, that I also use it as a daily driver around town :) For all these reasons, its probably one of my top 3 pieces of outdoor clothing.
review.name: Highly versatile, light and beloved jacket

review.reviewBody: I ordered this hoody for a climbing trip where we will be doing big multi pitch routes, starting early in the morning. This is the perfect piece for chilly mornings and its a zip up, so easy to shed. There are two hand pockets and a chest pocket. The hood is the perfect size, not too big or too small. Overall, the hoody looks great and is warm! Fits true to size.
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: The hoody is a heavy duty fabric, not as stretchy but more windproof than is typical fleece. The wool is not apparent, but it's only 5%. I have worn it a lot but not washed it yet. Fingers crossed it won't pill. It fits well: medium on my somewhat busty 5'4" 130 lb. The hood is a bit loose around my face and there are no thumb loops or holes, even though the description includes them. I like that the sleeves are tight enough that I can push them up and they stay in place on my skinny forearms when I wash my hands, etc. Much better than most - can be really annoying with these longer sleeves. The orange colour is like salmon. Maybe it should be called "lox"!
review.name: Perfect except for a couple of small things

review.reviewBody: Wow, I love this hoody! It feels cozy and fleecy without being bulky. I ordered my usual size (S) and it fits a little large, but that makes it great for layering. Its also kind of long. Im 52 and the length looks nice and isnt too tight on my curvy hips. I didnt realize that it has a little lined grid pattern on the exterior until I received it  but I like the unique look that gives it. Id buy it again if you make more colors!
review.name: Cozy

review.reviewBody: Durable, quick-drying, and designed for layering - it's slim-fit and stretchy so there's no bulk or bunching as I add layers (and additional hoods). And it's designed to cover hips so there's no "riding up" under a pack. Get it!
review.name: Perfect fit and stretch

review.reviewBody: I like that its long and the hood fits well under my helmet. Comfortable and easy to move in
review.name: Comfortable and breathable

review.reviewBody: So I want to love this fleece , and I would , but the zipper on the pocket came off my first or second time wearing it. I sent it in to be fixed, I got it back two months later. I wore it for the first time after it was replaced today, the zipper fell off 15 minutes into my hike. So not sure if these have issues with zippers being defective . I however will say its unbelievably warm, I can hike with just this over a base layer until its down to like 10 degrees. I do run warm however. Its the perfect balance of warmth and breathable. I dont feel like the wind blows through it super easily which is also nice. Its long enough that it covers some off my butt, the the sleeves are decently long too which I like. The hood is also very cozy. Another thing though , the edges around the sleeves and the bottom are already a little messed up after a few wears. I have the black diamond mitts and the second even the smallest part of the Velcro inside those catches the fleece it pulls at it a lot. Its like a Velcro magnet . Haha. Anyways, mixed feelings about this. I want to love it, but the durability is terrible. Definitely not the same quality as my synthetic jacket, puffy jacket, shell or mitts. Black diamond, you kind of let me down with this one. Really hoping theyll do something to resolve this.
review.name: Zipper broke again immediately after a warranty repair

review.reviewBody: I like that it doesnt have noticeable logos all over the hoodie. It fit well and washes great and still looks new every time.
review.name: Fits good

review.reviewBody: This jacket is a very comfortable layer that does not add bulk. It is super warm and the length is so nice on a tall girl.
review.name: Super warm and comfortable

name: Factor Fleece Hoodie - Women's

review.reviewBody: I've been buying Oboze Bridger Low B-Dry for years. Keep making these!
review.name: My favorite Hiking shoe

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Low B-Dry Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: GREAT service with an even greater delivery time.  The best low quarter boot Ive had with a very firm insole.
review.name: Bridger Low B Dry Hiking Boot

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Low B-Dry Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: The plastic edging bottom and the front plastic/rubber toe material and the leather upper started separating soon after I started wearing them.  I glued them and glued them but to no avail.  I should have returned them but...didn't for one reason or another...thought I could fix them.  And shortly after a year...separation is worse and the shoe is toast.  This happened even though I didn't hike in them that much...used mostly for outdoor work.  I bought top of the line because I thought they would last longer...also B-Dry.  They are good in the wet!
review.name: Andrew

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Low B-Dry Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have had major foot surgery on both feet which makes picking a hiking shoe very difficult.  Today's boots are being designed to be less weight, lighter fabric etc. which usually leads to overall less support for your feet.   The Oboz Bridger offers tremendous support for your feet.  It is a stiffer shank yet very comfortable.  The only con that I have is the tread is great except on slippery rocks.  The shoe does not excel in this area.  However, if great foot support is your primary concern, don't look any further, this is your hiking shoe.  I always order a 1/2 size up to accommodate my custom orthotics.   The Oboz insole is also one of the best for foot issues, but I require a bit more support.
review.name: If you have foot issues, this is for you

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Low B-Dry Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are relatively good hikers. Ive gone thru 2 pair and I like them. Mostly because they fit. I usually wear a 10 and thats what Ive gotten. They wear out  faster than Id like and things like the rubber bumpers delaminate but as long as they fit and have decent wearing capabilities thats what is important. Ive bought other oboz and they dont fit me, for whatever reason, so Im sorta committed to these. I would much rather buy them at a cheaper price and have the company leave out the highly vaunted insoles as I will get better ones right away anyway. As you can see the uppers are in much better shape than the soles. They grip well, so maybe thats the trade off.
review.name: Lots of use

review.itemreviewed: Bridger Low B-Dry Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great hiking shoe!
review.name: Love These Shoes!!

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GTC KIESPANZER C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have bib shorts from about five or six different manufacturers, and it really comes down to these bib shorts and Rapha. I bought these Assos MILLE GTC KIESPANZER BIB SHORTS C2 Size Medium, and I prefer them over Rapha mainly because they are so comfortable and sturdy. The compression is just right, and the straps are very sturdy (not flimsy, too narrow, or itchy like some straps). The fabric is also very comfortable on the skin and not itchy like with some shorts. I didnt give the shorts five stars for only one reason, and that is because I think the legs should be a little bit longer. If the legs were 2-3 cm longer, I wouldve given them five stars and its the only bib that I would ever buy ever again. Its not that the legs are too short, rather I just prefer a slightly longer leg. For reference, I bought these in a medium, and I am 511 and 176 pounds.
review.name: Love these bib shorts!

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GTC KIESPANZER C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Order a pair and within the first week, the welded seam at the belly came undone and a silicone band came out. Sent them back to CC and got a replacement pair. The second pair did the exact same thing after 1 ride. I expect this from Amazon bibs. Assos, unacceptable. Its a shame - they're comfortable. But for this price, that should never happen, let alone within a week - and on TWO PAIR!!
review.name: Unacceptable

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GTC KIESPANZER C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Out of the box and first impression is what youd expect from ASSOS. My 1st pair was worn on a 2hr trainer ride. After the ride I noticed that a.) they werent really any more comfortable than other bibs that were 1/2 the price and b.) the belly seam/weld came undone and there was an 8 strip of silicone band hanging out of them. For $270, NOT ok. Sent them back and got a replacement pair. Service from Backcountry was amazing. Second pair arrived and did the exact same 1st wear was on a trainer ride and voila, same failure. 
Have a feeling that most of the 5* reviews are from people that havent experimented with newer bibs. A quick google search reveals about 4 brands that make incredible long distance bibs for 1/2 the cost. Im old school and always had good luck with ASSOS. Theyre like the Land Rover of bibs. Really impressive junk.
review.name: Garbage TWICE

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GTC KIESPANZER C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
This is my 3rd pair of these bib shorts and I'm not sure that I will buy any other short in the future. Bought the first two a couple of years ago and don't wear virtually any other of the shorts in the stable. While I know that chamois fit is unique to each person, I can say that at least for me, this chamois is perfect. It has just the right amount of padding in exactly the right places. No chaffing, no saddle sores whether I'm on the road, on gravel or on a trail. All that plus the cargo pockets that hold their shape independent of how much I put in them. I really don't like to carry stuff in my jersey pockets so these are just what I needed.

Buy them, you won't regret it!
review.name: Comfort & Function

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GTC KIESPANZER C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Im not too satisfied with this purchase. I own several pairs of Assos, and like them. The fabric is scratchy, not a good feel on, etc. Not one of my better purchases. Not very happy with them.
review.name: Assos bibs

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GTC KIESPANZER C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Fantastic set of bibs with side pockets and enough movement to pull the front down to go pee!!!  Size was dead-on. Extremely comfortable. The shoulder straps cause no issues and allowed for  movement and body mobility.
review.name: Mille bibs

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GTC KIESPANZER C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Awesome bibs.  Love the storage in the small of the back.  Wish more Assos bibs had this feature.  I use these for MTB and gravel and love them.  Typical Assos sizing.
review.name: Perfec

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GTC KIESPANZER C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Ive tried many brands of bibs until finally relenting and spending the money for Assos. I never turned back after that as Assos truly makes the finest bibs! Now that Ive worn all seasons of Assos for many years I began thinking theres really nowhere new to gobut these convinced me otherwise. The added internal pockets allow me to carry extra nutrition (or carry, IYKWIM) and the external pockets are another added luxury if I decide to bring my phone, more snacks, kitchen sink, etc. I love these for both gravel and road. Chapeau, Assos!
review.name: Absolute Assos Perfection

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GTC KIESPANZER C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are the most comfortable bibs Ive ever owned. Used them on multiple rides on mixed terrain of 50+ miles with no issues.
review.name: Great bibs

review.itemreviewed: MILLE GTC KIESPANZER C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I've only used them for four rides, but each was a longer/more climbing ride than normal, including VT Monster Gravel.  Never a pinching or bunching that I had to fix.  Extremely comfortable for all day bouncing around in the saddle.  This is my first pair of Assos.  Ordered direct from Assos (nice Amex $50 off $200 offer + 10% first order sweetened the deal) and kind of glad I did as it suggested a size small instead of my usual medium, which wound up being the right size.  Straps were comfortable enough that I didn't notice them. 
Side pockets were useful for a couple of gel packets or waffles each side.  They still look streamlined and held contents in place.  The only knock I could say is that the interior flap to the pocket is pretty deep and makes it a touch difficult to pull out of pocket, but probably there to hold stuff securely.  Also, when putting on, I would avoid tugging at the sides to pull up the bibs.
If these last (and I expect they will), they will be a great investment in comfort and performance.
For reference, my legs run a little longer in proportion than my chest.
review.name: Just awesome

name: MILLE GTC KIESPANZER C2 Bib Short - Men's
